title: Auto- & Explainable- ML
text:
A cross-platform application of auto-ML and explainable-ML to investigate to what extent they might be compatible
See more here

title: Sentiment Analysis Comparison
text:
vader compound sentiment scores and the classification obtained from Hugging Face’s cardiffnlp/twitter-xlm-roberta-base-sentiment transformer model are compared.
See more here

title: Causal segmentation
text:
Expecting homogeneous effects from experimental treatments might border on naivety sometimes. Especially, if we have large samples in A/B testing. This project is an implementation of Netflix’s sherlock on a convenient sample of German voters.
See more here

title: Attitudes towards COVID-19 and voting intention in Germany
text:
The project uncovers subgroups of voters in Germany utilizing their beliefs towards the effectiveness of government measures, reported compliance with a possible curfew, and trust in various institutions during the early stages of the Corona pandemic. The uncovered segments of voters predict their voting intentions with acceptable accuracy.
See more here

title: Recommender system
text:
Together with Pietro Passarella, we built a movie recommender with a web interface utilizing the small movielens dataset.
See more here

title: Time series
text:
Google offers Google trends topics – a group of already clustered search terms that share the same concept or entity.
Search terms underpinning five interrelated ideologies pulled from Google Trends topics data are examined to understand the best way to model the trends and relationships.
See more here

title: Measuring organizational practices
text:
What started as the boot camp graduation project turned into a mature product that assesses organizational culture from both employee reviews and company mission and vision statements.

The product helps to understand

the gap between a company’s desired and actual culture
where the company stands in comparison to industry averages

See the initial version here, contact me directly for more info on the more mature version.

title: Tweet stream data pipeline for a Slackbot
text:
An implementation of a dockerized data pipeline that sends randomized tweets about politics together with their sentiment scores
The Docker-Compose pipeline includes five containers.

collects tweets with the Twitter API and tweepy
stores the tweets in a MongoDB
applies an ETL job that

extracts the tweets from MongoDB
gets the sentiments of the texts with VADERSentiment

loads the tweets and their sentiment scores in a Postgres database
creates a Slackbot that post a randomly selected anonymized tweet from the Postgres database into a Slack channel.

See more here
